comments.commentBody:
john, what you call "pharmaceutical labeling" should include medical trial side effects especially for drugs with violent side effects such as suicide and murder.

These include SSRIs, psychotropics and anti-depressives.

If labeling doesn't mention these, then there should be a label of whether or not there were medical trials for the use the prescription is being used and if there were medical trials why the medical trials did not report the side effects.

This requires due diligence when writing algos.

I have absolutely no problem with "instant threat - instant kill" scenarios and having a seal team 6, a delta force, etc. exist and be the most elite warriors for these types of scenarios.

What turns my stomach is that murders are being committed by some of these men, not in the heat of battle, but out of revenge (murdering Wallakah) or just because they can (shooting an unarmed girl who posed no threat). And instead of investigations occurring and these men brought to justice, they're just sent back home. So some of these men are trained killers who are also sick in the head murderers. When they muster out, who do you think they become a danger to?

Again, I'm sure the majority of JSOC operators are patriots to be thanked. But it's clearly not each and every one of them. And those few "bad apples" need to be investigated and prosecuted if they've done wrong. It turns my stomach that so many commenters would simply turn a blind eye. And then you wonder why so many people over there hate us.

To abortion and women's rights, equal pay, voter rights, prosecution of Wall Streeters, regulation of polluters, etc etc etc. --Republicans say NO!!
Hillary says the opposite. So what exactly would you hold her feet to the fire about??

Hillary Clinton should have her feet held to the fire, as should every candidate.  But I'm more interested in policy:  abortion and women's rights, equal pay, voter  rights, prosecution of Wall Streeters, regulation of polluters, etc etc etc.  Republicans are foul, as stark a contrast as America has had since pre-Lincoln, so if I fundamentally agree with Mr Bruni--I will hold my nose and vote--I am more hopeful than he is that when Ms Clinton is the President of the United States, she will do even better than her husband did.
You forgot the Bay of Pigs, which we clearly organized, funded, and led.
The world has known about the SEALs for a long time. It has not been a secret, even Charlie Sheen made a movie about them over twenty years ago..
You might wish to ponder how the view became available for it to be published.

I agree with the sentiment behind your comment. Unfortunately there are times when you need to kill other people who want to kill you. There is certainly plenty of room to question whether the two are kept in proper balance.

Like nearly everything else, the "correct" approach is usually trying to intelligently maintain a position in the gray zone, and the "wrong" choice is almost always at either extreme.

I am retired Child Protective Investigator. The college applicant was in the foster care system at a time when the laws were slanted towards biological parents. The parents could wander in and out of court ordered programs for years, while never making any progress. In the meantime, the children would go in and out of placements, with no permanent plan in place. The law then made a major shift: permanency planning that favored the child. Now parents have a year to get their acts together. If that does not happen, then the child welfare agency files  petitions to terminate parental rights and thus free children for adoption and "forever homes."  Children are freed for adoption at much younger ages and with far less problems than in the old days.
Mine too.

As a democracy, we are all ultimately responsible for what these people do in our name. It is difficult to be responsible for anything without the knowledge to reach decisions.

Yours truly,
A REAL AMERICAN
It was really something.  When he left the gate, you knew he was gone.  I didn't see that level of energy in any other horse there.
Just don't start gambling

My husband who went to Medical School in Louisville used to  tell me how  exciting the races were. I dd not understand why people got so excited.  I  dd watch the Belmont and American Pharaoh  race.  I found myself rooting for the horse.  Now I am fan for ever.

Horses are herd animals, and every herd has an alpha male. Even on a farm, other horses stand aside while the alpha is fed first.

I hope Pharoah enjoys a nice rest and we see him next in the Travers at Saratoga.

On the contrary-Drape's prose was perfect! I've ridden all my life and have seen every Triple Crown race for decades-many in person. Drape's rolling marbles and trampoline strides perfectly capture the incredibly fluid way that American Pharaoh moves, and all racing fans (if not betters) roared from DEEP in our souls yesterday in appreciation of the beauty in those effortless strides after years of disappointment and frustration.

i've never ridden a horse at a full gallop because they scare the daylights out of me, having been viciously kicked by one of the beasts, but when you watch the jockey perched up high on his legs, his back almost parallel to the ground and not moving, his legs taking all the rhythm of the bounding horse beneath him, when you're that good at your job i think you get to describe it as riding a cloud.
Sounds like your sense of the figurative is dead last paying 5000 to 1.
A fabulous piece of writing, too!
Thank you.  I never saw him run, but I went to his farewell appearance at Belmont.  I still have Penny Tweedy's autograph, which I got that day.  That was in 10th grade. A memory of a lifetime.
Ms. Dowd has always been a sucker for a pretty (male) face.  And Frenchmen always seem to know how to charm the ladies (Dominique Strauss-Kahn to the contrary).
What percentage of public school students in Arizona are here because their parents are in the United States illegally?

smlynch - the Disparity is over 60%.
No median vs. Mean is going to explain away that.
I have no idea why you want to compare teachers to physicians - salary-wise.

This is really simple - we spend pretty much more than anybody in the world and our results are horrible.
The SOLUTION is not to spend more....
That is - unless you are a teacher - then the cry is spend away.

strt716:
The real issue is that the benefits of undocumented immigration are not felt by everyone. Agricultural and other businesses - like landscapers and contractors, benefit tremendously. Schools, hospitals, and law enforcement don't. Police departments struggle with different cultural norms, and that takes resources - but they're actually the lucky ones. Our public hospitals are bound by law to accept patients regardless of their ability to pay. Many undocumented laborers fit that bill.
.
Our schools are required similarly to teach all students. Non-English speakers need extra resources, but while the Federal Government is happy to tell school districts they have to accept undocumented students, they don't provide anywhere near sufficient funding to teach those kids. Then add their obsession with standardized tests, and the ill conceived "common core," and a laundry list of other rigid, bureacpucratic requirements, and it paints a very scary picture.
Andrew Cuomo seems to be reading the ALEC playbook.
No additional costs? When you have a child in your classroom who doesn't speak English?
Negative, Ghostrider. History is our evidence. Wars are our proof.

ISIS is a shell game as it's not an existential threat to the USA. The fact that North Korea can hit the USA with nuclear or chemical warheads through missiles, submarines and technology supplied by Pakistan, Russia and China is a real threat. So is the fact that our allies Saudi Arabia and other Gulf States and Pakistan finance fundamentalist terrorism.

The exploits of the Navy Seals are the type of nonsense our political leaders feed us to avoid confrontations over our real security problems. If Seymour Hersh is to be believed, Bin Laden was a prisoner of the Pakistanis and we discovered that through an informer and were given permission and air cover to go in by Pakistan on condition we executed him. There were no shots fired at the Seals and no daring do - this was a reelection ploy. BTW bin Laden was not buried at sea but pieces of him were thrown out of a helicopter as they traveled back to Afghanistan. I'm not one for conspiracy theories but Hersch is a respected award winning investigative journalist.
Yeah, the Republican candidates aren't any good, and I want a woman president, but Hillary does not appeal to me.  We need another breath of fresh air like Obama.  Where is she?

"Murdered schoolchildren" presumably means the Sandy Hook tragedy. So what exactly did your Mr. Obama do about that? What marvelous speeches? Can you remember any of them? More importantly, was the public moved or influenced by them? And what action did Obama take? He appointed his VP Joe Biden to some committee to investigate. What came of that? NOTHING.
... Or disadvantage in a country that yearns for simplistic, angry rhetoric as a viable substitute for challenging ideas.

Frank, I'm no Hillary fan, but when you compare her to the Republican wrecking ball of utter nihilism, she's the most beautiful thing in the constellation.

At least she can string coherent sentences and paragraphs together on a variety of complex subjects as opposed to right-wing candidates spouting thoughtless and discredited clichés in response to real problems.

The Presidency is a hard job and it requires intelligence, experience, articulation and personal resolve - Hillary has those things.

What's a Republican President's response going to be to the next classroom full of murdered schoolchildren ?

I'm sure Hillary Clinton won't say we just need more stupid and fatal guns to solve the problem.

What's a Republican President's response going to be the ongoing healthcare issues in America ? Repeal 'Obamacare' and bring back 'pre-existing' conditions and uninsure the 16 million who've gained health insurance ?

The problem that Republicans is they have no ideas besides tax cut nihilism and they're fundamentally incoherent when it comes to good governance.

Say what you will about Hillary - she's not incoherent and she's not disconnected from reality.

That gives Hillary an enormous advantage over every Republican candidate.

When you choose to do graduate work at an incredibly expensive college such as Columbia University you know you are taking on 80K in debt. This is a bad choice for someone for whom a lucrative career means self-disgust and lifelong unhappiness. If you are more suited to being an artist, writer, teacher, or social worker (all admirable choices) then you should factor you future earning potential into you choice of schools. The author states that his education opened a new life for him. Shouldn't one pay the debts they make, even if they feel later that they made a bad choice?

Bankruptcy and a fresh start is one of the best parts of the American social structure. It is wrong that students can not practically avail themselves of this good idea. If enabling bankruptcy means the student loan program is cut back, so be it. Nobody wins when people spend their entire lives running from creditors.
